results.title: Turner Classic Movies Is Changing. And Trying to Stay the Same.
results.abstract: A brand refresh for TCM, the cable home to countless vintage films, raises questions about its future within an increasingly streaming-centric TV world.

multimedia.caption: Turner Classic Movies has undertaken a makeover, not a change of mission. But the host Ben Mankiewicz, left, with Ava DuVernay, still thinks loyal fans “are going to have a small heart attack.”
multimedia.copyright: Anne Marie Fox/TCM, via Associated Press

results.title: Nia DaCosta on ‘Candyman’ and the Power of Terrifying Legends
results.abstract: For her horror redo, the filmmaker confronted the pressures for success. “There are a lot of people that you want to do well for, and that can be daunting.”

multimedia.caption: Nia DaCosta said that for her, “growing up, Candyman was real. He wasn’t coming from a movie.”

results.title: Rachael Leigh Cook Was Always Worth the Bet
results.abstract: After more than 25 years in Hollywood, the star of millennial classics like “She’s All That” and “Josie and the Pussycats” is ready for a new chapter.

multimedia.caption: Rachael Leigh Cook in Beverly Hills this summer. “I’m a lifer. I’ve been around the block,” she said. “It used to be so not OK for a woman to even get older. Now, I’m older and somehow it’s OK.”
multimedia.copyright: Amy Harrity for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Rachael Leigh Cook in Beverly Hills this summer. “I’m a lifer. I’ve been around the block,” she said. “It used to be so not OK for a woman to even get older. Now, I’m older and somehow it’s OK.”

results.title: Mikis Theodorakis, Greek Composer and Marxist Rebel, Dies at 96
results.abstract: He waged a war of words and music against a military junta that banned his work and imprisoned him during its rule of Greece, from 1967 to 1974.
des_facet: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

multimedia.caption: The Greek composer and political activist Mikis Theodorakis at the United Nations in 1970. He was best known internationally for his scores for the films “Zorba the Greek,” “Z” and “Serpico.”

results.title: Ed Asner, Emmy-Winning Star of ‘Lou Grant’ and ‘Up,’ Dies at 91
results.abstract: Best known as the gruff newsman he first played on “The Mary Tyler Moore Show,” he was also a busy character actor and a political activist.
des_facet: The Mary Tyler Moore Show (TV Program)

results.title: How ‘Candyman’ Star Yahya Abdul-Mateen II Became the Next Big Name
results.abstract: The actor’s career has surged thanks to projects like “Aquaman” and “Watchmen.” He’s even become a Warner Bros. favorite. Now on the brink of movie stardom, he’s ready to steer.

multimedia.caption: “Sometimes it’s like, ‘Look, man, I want to get off the wave and create my own,’” Yahya Abdul Mateen II said.
